page.title: 17Military Relics
page.content: There are buildings in Trimley and Shotley left behind by the Army and the Navy. The buildings at H.M.S.Ganges are still in good condition but elsewhere there are ruins and derelict buildings. On Fagbury Cliff there is a pillbox for soldiers to cover the river. In Cordy's Lane,near Keeper's Cottage there are roadways and concrete buildings which children usually call "The Fort". We explored the buildings and found places where guns had been fixed. Most of the buildings were empty. A lady who lived in the village during World War 2 told us that there had been anti aircraft guns and search lights down there.They were meant to protect the motor torpedo boat and seaplane bases on the Orwell.
